messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On January 5, DET. F. M. Booker was alerted to an incident at the Riverside Park. Central informants included Mr. Harris, a jogger, and Ms. King, a park ranger. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. J. D. Maxwell - OPERATIONS Det. Booker, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS TANNER 19:03 Vandalism Mr. Harris noticed freshly painted graffiti on the park's central statue, while Ms. King reported seeing a group with spray cans earlier that day. Wrist. Technician Carla collected paint samples. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Booker Jr OPERATIONS Lt. Maxwell INFORMANT King, Ellen 52 Willow Lane, Riverside, California 125-428. 91033. TANNER 19:03 Vandalism By 4:15 PM, Detective Booker and Lieutenant Maxwell took statements and photographed the affected areas. Captain B. L. Graham recommended increased evening patrols. Sergeant R. L. Hayes will coordinate with local schools to identify possible culprits. At 5:30 PM, gathered evidence, including spray can caps, was sent for fingerprinting. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Booker Jr Lt. Maxwell AFFIDAVIT - Incident Report 1) Photographs 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Paint Samples 5) Park Entry Logs (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE T. Roberts R.P.D. 6.55 P22 0883 Harris, JOHN NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 60-1125 DETECTIVE: F. BOOKER ITEM: 22-4256- 83 CRIME: 19:03 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 80860 - CONFIRMED Jane Doe DATE 7/03/22 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. F. M. Booker  Officer Context: On January 5, DET. F. M. Booker was alerted to an incident at the Riverside Park. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. J. D. Maxwell  Officer Context: Lt. J. D. Maxwell - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Technician Carla  Officer Context: Wrist. Technician Carla collected paint samples. Officer Role: Technician Officer Name: Detective Booker  Officer Context: By 4:15 PM, Detective Booker and Lieutenant Maxwell took statements and photographed the affected areas. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain B. L. Graham  Officer Context: Captain B. L. Graham recommended increased evening patrols. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant R. L. Hayes  Officer Context: Sergeant R. L. Hayes will coordinate with local schools to identify possible culprits. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Lieutenant Maxwell  Officer Context: By 4:15 PM, Detective Booker and Lieutenant Maxwell took statements and photographed the affected areas. Officer Role: Lieutenant
